reveal.motive: Jealousy and perceived betrayal after escalating conflict; control dynamics visible in recent messages.

title: The Lighthouse Keeper: Murder at Hollow Point
fullSolutionText: Captain Edwin Marsh confronted Thomas Hale inside the lighthouse during the storm of November 3rd, 1989. Their long-standing resentment and jealousy over Lydia Hale led to a violent argument. Hale fell from the staircase after being struck during the struggle, hitting the railing before the floor. The dual impact found in the forensic report confirms this. To avoid scandal and protect the town’s reputation, Chief Griggs ordered the death ruled as accidental, and Noah Price manipulated the weather records to erase the crucial 23:10–23:40 window. For decades, Hollow Point lived by silence—its people choosing peace over truth. You’ve uncovered what the sea and the storm tried to bury.

title: The Fifth Witness
fullSolutionText: You found the truth. The fifth witness never existed — he was the detective who wrote the reports, signed the autopsy, and hid behind his own handwriting. Detective Mercer was at the scene, his memory split into four voices so he could live with what he’d done. The lavender on her hands, the reflection in the glass, the erased minutes... were all his. He didn’t remember her death — he remembered the guilt.

title: Trick or Treat Gone Wrong
prompt: Who murdered Brooke Miller on Halloween night?
fullSolutionText: You uncovered the truth: Noah Price engineered the perfect blackout to silence Brooke Miller — and the town’s forgotten secret.

reveal.motive: To conceal his involvement in the 2022 electrical fire that killed Harold Miller. Brooke had uncovered proof linking him to both incidents.
reveal.method: Noah manually looped the breaker wiring at 14 Elm Street, causing a planned power outage at 11:45 PM. Under the cover of darkness, he struck Brooke with a blunt object and later staged the 'LIE' pumpkins to frame Claire Young.
evidence: Electrical panel inspection revealed deliberate wire looping matching Noah’s prior maintenance signature.
Box-cutter residue and matching tool marks from Noah’s kit identified on all three pumpkins.
DNA from pumpkin stems confirmed Noah’s handling postmortem.
Doorbell recording contained Noah’s whisper at [0:09] ('Just end it'), verified through 95% voiceprint match.
Officer Myers’ 2022 case notes referenced identical breaker cut angles from the Miller Sweet Shop fire.
Tara Jenkins confirmed Brooke obtained the candy recorder from her, which contained fragments exposing Noah’s name.
timeline: 10:30 PM — Pumpkins observed uncarved by witnesses.
11:15 PM — Brooke argues with Claire: 'You can’t keep lying forever.'
11:35 PM — Brooke positions pumpkins by the fireplace.
11:45 PM — Power outage triggered; scream heard seconds later.
11:47 PM — Brooke found unresponsive; candles still unlit.
11:56 PM — Officer Myers arrives; Noah calm, near the panel.
00:12 AM — Forensics log shows Noah’s fingerprints and tool residue on panel box.
reveal.epilogue: Noah Price masked his crime beneath the flicker of a Halloween prank. The same man who once 'fixed' the shop wiring that killed Harold Miller ended another Miller life to keep that secret buried. Officer Myers’s silence let him hide a year longer — but every lie leaves its trace, even when carved in pumpkin flesh.

incorrect.generic: Not quite. Think about who had access to the electrical panel, the technical skill to manipulate the breakers, and a reason to silence Brooke permanently.

bySuspect.claire: Claire lied, yes — but she was hiding guilt over silence, not murder.
bySuspect.evan: Evan’s footage caught the sound of the killer, not his own crime.
bySuspect.liam: He set the scene by mistake but never touched the panel.
bySuspect.tara: She gave Brooke the candy bag, not the death sentence.
bySuspect.officer myers: He protected Noah through negligence, not intent.

title: The Last Thanksgiving
fullSolutionText: Catherine Boone poisoned Arthur Holloway. Years ago, Arthur’s company, Holloway Holdings, covered up a factory accident that killed Daniel Boone — Catherine’s husband. The case was buried, and Arthur lived with that secret while Catherine raised their son, Liam, in silence. When Arthur decided to revise his will to publicly make amends, Catherine knew his confession would come too late to matter. On Thanksgiving night, she poured his final glass of wine, laced with arsenic, and left him to the same quiet fate he had given her family years before. She did not act out of rage, but out of a cold, deliberate sense of balance — the kind of justice Arthur once denied others.

title: Silent Night, Deadly Secret
prompt: Who killed Harold Finch at the Evergreen Charity Gala?
fullSolutionText: You uncovered the truth. Event coordinator Tina Mallory orchestrated Harold Finch’s death during the blackout at the Evergreen Charity Gala. She poisoned his mulled wine moments before cutting the power to mask the act. Motive: revenge for years of manipulation and professional humiliation under Finch’s control. Method: ethyl cyanohydrin, introduced through the drink during her timed call to the bar at 8:13 PM. Evidence: the bar call record, Nick Carson’s statement about a woman’s voice giving orders, and Tina’s final message — 'Everyone will get exactly what they deserve.'

reveal.motive: Revenge and retribution after years of professional manipulation and personal betrayal by Harold Finch.
reveal.method: Poisoned mulled wine prepared under the pretext of bar coordination minutes before the power outage.
evidence: Bar call record at 8:13 PM initiated by Tina.
Witness Nick Carson heard a female voice giving an instruction to serve Finch’s drink.
Tina’s threatening messages: 'Details are what kill you' and 'Enjoy your wine.'
Zoning of the blackout matched the electrical panel controlled from her station.

8:13 PM — Tina calls the bar to confirm 'service sequence.'
8:14–8:17 PM — Planned blackout hides the poisoning moment.
8:18 PM — Lights return; Finch collapses beside the tree.
reveal.epilogue: Tina Mallory’s calm coordination masked her guilt until the digital evidence exposed the truth. Justice, like Christmas lights, flickers only when someone decides to turn it on.
